Class AddEventModal

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.stage.Window
      • javafx.stage.Stage
        • view.AddEventModal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class AddEventModal
extends javafx.stage.Stage
    This modal can be used to add, edit, and display events, described in detail in the constructor
    Author:
    Amin Sennour

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddEventModal

        public AddEventModal(boolean editable,
                     CalendarEvent event,
                     CalendarController c,
                     java.time.LocalDate date)
        Constructor for the modal, used for adding, viewing and editing events. Two use cases. 1. Add event. Pass true for editable and null for the event 2. View / edit event. Pass false for editable and the event for event
        Parameters:
        editable - this boolean indicates if the modal is editable by default
        event - this is the event, pass null if your'e creating a new event, else the values from this will be used to populate the modal, allowing for viewership, and this event will be removed from the model if the user chooses to edit

    • Method Detail

      • localDateAndHourToDate

        public static java.util.Date localDateAndHourToDate(java.time.LocalDate date,
                                                    int hour)
        Handles the logic of converting the information from the local date and hour integer into a java "Date" object
        Parameters:
        date - the local date being converted
        hour - the hour on the local date to also be converted
        Returns:
        the new java "date" representation of the above info
